sense.def:
To check something
pomeni prepričati se, da je nekaj zadovoljivo, varno ali pravilno.

seg.quote: Tony came in from time to time, to check on my progress.
He needed a chance to check with Hooper to see if his theory was plausible.
He checked that both rear doors were safely shut.

sense.def:
A check
je postopek, s katerim preverimo, ali je vse pravilno ali varno.

seg.quote: Checks on cars and televisions are thorough.

sense.def:
To check something
pomeni tudi preprečiti, da bi se nekaj nadaljevalo ali širilo.

seg.quote: The destruction of the bridge checked the enemy's advance.

gramGrp.pos:
REFL VB
or
VB
with
OBJ

sense.def:
To check oneself
ali kadar nekaj
checks someone
pomeni, da tisti človek nenadoma prekine s tistim, kar počne ali govori.

seg.quote: He began to saunter off, then checked himself and turned back.
Sudhir held up his hand to check him.

sense.def:
To keep something in check
pomeni nekaj imeti pod nadzorom.

seg.quote: He had not conquered inflation but he had held it in check.

sense.def:
V restavraciji v Ameriki
a check
pomeni isto kot v Veliki Britaniji
a bill
.

seg.quote: ...a tall man in a check suit.

sense.def:
Kadar človek
checks into a hotel
ali
checks in
, izpolni potrebne formularje, preden se nastani v hotelu.

seg.quote: He checked into a small boarding house.
I checked in at the Gordon Hotel.

sense.def:
To check in
pomeni tudi pokazati letalsko vozovnico pred vkrcanjem na letalo.

seg.quote: He had already checked in for his return flight.

sense.def:
To check out of a hotel
pomeni plačati račun in oditi iz hotela, v katerem smo bili nastanjeni.

seg.quote: Mr Leonard checked out this afternoon, Miss.

sense.def:
To check something out
pomeni pozanimati se o nečem.

seg.quote: It might be difficult to transfer your money, so check it out with the manager.

sense.def:
To check up on someone or something
pomeni priskrbeti si podatke o nekom ali nečem.
